astronomy book.description: The title of the book, and the rest of it, seem to be entirely in Latin. There's a cross stamped on the spine.
astronomy book.inside: The book is in Latin, so you can't read it. But it looks as though it's about astronomy, as there are pages full of astronomical tables.
astronomy book.name: astronomy book

banana.description: It's a banana. Why are you examining it.
banana.name: banana

chalk.description: A piece of chalk. Pretty boring, really.
chalk.name: chalk

charter book.description: It's a plain brown book, small enough to fit in the palm of your hand.
charter book.inside: It's full of spells! There's one that looks right at your level. You read it, and suddenly feel like you've been totally immersed in the Charter.
charter book.name: charter book

dagger.description: A silver dagger in a leather scabbard, attached to a belt. The blade looks quite sharp and there are Charter marks etched on the hilt.
dagger.name: dagger

dark history book.description: It's titled "Fifteenth-Century Fiends," author unknown. There are three small stars stamped on the spine.
dark history book.inside: This is a history book. It's pretty depressing; there are lots of stories of beheadings and Muggle torture.
dark history book.name: dark history book

diary.description: This looks like someone's personal notebook, maybe a diary. The cover is blue and paneled. There is a clock stamped on the spine.
diary.inside: It's someone's notes, in very small, neat handwriting. Whoever it is must have some sort of personal code because you can't read what they've written.
diary.name: diary

drama book.description: It seems to be a translated copy of Poetics II, the lost Aristotelian essay on comedic drama. There is a cross stamped on the spine.
drama book.inside: It's just Aristotle's theories on Greek comedic drama. Boring. Go read something with magic in it.
drama book.name: drama book

epic book.description: A copy of Homer's "Illiad." There is a scroll stamped on the spine.
epic book.inside: When you open it, you notice that the book is heavily marked in many different handwritings.
epic book.name: epic book

fairy tale book.description: It has a brown leather cover, embossed with the title: "Grimm's Fairy Tales." There is a red rose stamped on the spine.
fairy tale book.inside: These stories seem kind of gruesome, you note as you flip through the book. There seem to be an awful lot of people getting eaten and/or stabbing each other.
fairy tale book.name: fairy tale book

fantasy book.description: This book MAY be even heavier than the librarians' ledger. There's a picture of a boy with black hair and glasses on the cover, and three small stars stamped on the spine.
fantasy book.inside: It seems like this is another novel. This one is a fantasy novel about a wizard and his two friends and the dark wizard they fight.
fantasy book.name: fantasy book

floral book.description: There's a patterened motif of vines and flowers covering this book, which is a copy of "Jack and the Beanstalk." There's also a red rose stamped on the spine.
floral book.inside: It looks like someone's run rampant with the story here; this is a full novelisation of Jack and the Beanstalk.
floral book.name: floral book

french book.description: The book has a plain brown cloth cover that says, "La Belle et la Bete." The only other adornment is a red rose on the spine.
french book.inside: It's beautifully illustrated, with gold leaf covering the hand-drawn pictures of Belle and the beast.
french book.name: french book

key.description: It's a silver bracelet, set with seven emeralds. One is glowing.
key.name: key

labyrinth book.description: This book is titled "The Name of the Rose." There's a cross stamped on the spine.
labyrinth book.inside: The book seems to be a novel about two monks, set in a strange world without magic.
labyrinth book.name: labyrinth book

ledger.description: It's a large leather ledger. It's incredibly heavy, and when you open it you feel as though it contains every piece of equipment checked out by every librarian in the history of the Clayr. It's that big. You probably don't want to carry it around.
ledger.inside: As you expected, the book is full of lists of equipment checked out to past librarians. And there's your name, at the very bottom! There's a list of equipment for you, including a dagger, a clockwork mouse, a key, and a yellow waistcoat. Now, I wonder where those things could be. (You didn't lose them already, did you?)
ledger.name: ledger

magic book.description: This book is called "The Colour of Magic" by Terry Pratchett. There's a turtle stamped on the spine.
magic book.inside: It's another novel. This time it's about an incompetent wizard who falls off the edge of the world.
magic book.name: magic book

mouse.description: It's a small clockwork mouse, about the size of your fist. There's a turnkey sticking out of the back. Interestingly, it also buzzes in your hand, like it's connected to the Charter somehow.
mouse.name: mouse

odyssean book.description: A copy of Homer's "Odyssey." There is a scroll stamped on the spine.
odyssean book.inside: When you open it, you notice that the book is heavily marked in many different handwritings.
odyssean book.name: odyssean book

phial.description: A small crystal phial. It's sealed with powerful Charter magic.
phial.name: phial

potions book.description: It's titled "Most Potente Potions" by Phineas Bourne. The cover is leather, but looks strangely oily and almost appears to be moving. There are three small stars stamped on the spine.
potions book.inside: There are directions in here for all sorts of strange potions; you managed to open it to the page about brewing a Laxative Potion.
potions book.name: potions book

princess book.description: This book has a red cover. The title is "The Princess Bride," and there's a red rose on the spine.
princess book.inside: Far-off places, daring swordfights, magic spells, and a prince in disguise!
princess book.name: princess book

red waistcoat.description: A red waistcoat. Looking down, you decide that red is a much better color on you than yellow. There's a whistle clipped to the lapel.
red waistcoat.name: red waistcoat

south african book.description: The title is "Cry, the Beloved Country" by Alan Paton. There's a purple eye stamped on the spine. The dustjacket is patterned with flowers.
south african book.inside: It appears to be about a South African priest looking for his son.
south african book.name: south african book

statue.description: It's a small soapstone statue of a dog. The nose is rubbed smooth.
statue.name: statue

translation book.description: It's an orangutan-to-English translation book, printed by the Unseen University Press.
translation book.inside: The first entry indicates that "Ooook ook." means "I am filled with existential angst."
translation book.name: translation book

western book.description: The book is called "Death Comes for the Archbishop," by Willa Cather. It has a plain brown dustjacket, with a silhouette of a horse and rider. There's a purple eye stamped on the spine.
western book.inside: Flipping through it briefly, you see references to the Mexican-American War and catholicism.
western book.name: western book

wire.description: A piece of wire about a foot long.
wire.name: wire

yellow waistcoat.description: A yellow waistcoat. It flatters you quite nicely. And so professional! There's a whistle clipped to the lapel.
yellow waistcoat.name: yellow waistcoat
